_comment: Created by ianb on 04/11/2014 13:15:49 using v2.2
title: How has penicillin prescribing changed over time?
analysis_commentary: The number of broad-spectrum penicillins (includes amoxicillin) dispensed has been gradually increasing from 15.3 million items in 2003 to 16.7 million items in 2012. In 2013 we observed a decline to 15.4 million items. The use of penicillinase-resistant penicillins has also been increasing over time, from 3.2million items in 2003 to 4.3 million in 2013.
data_source: Health and Social Care Information Centre, Prescriptions Dispensed in the Community
